data.text: @WC3JnLzhRzzQ5rz @Reuters They are under negotiation, and it's going to be the third round as I remember. Also, if someone wants to invade you, they always find a reason. Yes, he may destroy the world, but fear is exactly what he wants you to feel, so you do what he wants.
@tw_tiunn @Reuters Now Putin is crazy, don't give him a chance to negotiate, are you sure he won't pull 7 billion people to die with him? I thought the news kept saying he was crazy！Is this fake?
@WC3JnLzhRzzQ5rz @Reuters Well, then at least join the sanction like other countries?
@tw_tiunn @Reuters After all, foreign countries have always looked down on China. China is only a small country. Shouldn't it be a big country like the United States to stop the war?

@tw_tiunn @Reuters China does not support Russia, please don't lie. China has been asking both sides to move the war to the negotiating table. Instead, the West and the US have been blocking negotiations between the two sides. Why should China do so much?

@Reuters the hadith about dreams says that there is no more prophethood after the Prophet except in the form of dreams. The meaning is that the prophetic news is still there but only in the form of a dream. Muhammad Qasim’s dreams indicate he is Imam Al Mahdi. https://t.co/8NLrUV5fgH
@JoanneHsu13 @taipao_tang @Reuters 笑死了，怎么敢的啊哈巴狗，你们那都什么样了，摁字前先崛起你粉黑的屁股想想，你妈被我一上一下的时候也没这么傻逼过👏👏👏
@Reuters Welding the door of the residents? Put them in camps?
@maddoghasfleas @Reuters It’s their normal dirty way to fuck China
